author: Staff Reporter
text:
A bomb scare at a private school and adjoining college under the same management triggered panic in Cuddalore on Monday. News spread like wildfire, leading to parents making desperate calls to check about the safety of their children in several schools in Cuddalore town.

Unidentified caller

Police sources said an employee of the CK School at Chellankuppam received a threat over telephone that bombs have been placed in the school and college run by the same management. The unidentified caller again called the school after 10 minutes and disconnected.

The school authorities immediately alerted the police who combed the institutions and found no explosive material. The threat triggered panic and parents of students rushed to the school to pick up their wards. The management later declared a holiday.

Soon rumours spread that three other schools at Periyakanganakuppam and Sorakalpattu were being targeted and anxious parents rushed to the institutions.

There were altercations between parents and the management and the schools also declared a holiday.

Meanwhile, the police are investigating the phone number to identify the caller. Police suspect that some students might have made the prank call as the plus two practical examinations commenced on Monday.
title: Bomb scare in school
